title: Twitter reacts to Demian Maia's submission of Ben Askren at UFC on ESPN+ 20
text:
Gallery Demian Maia def. Ben Askren at UFC on ESPN+ 20: Best photos view 12 images

Demian Maia added to his stature as one of the winningest fighters in UFC history on Saturday when he defeated Ben Askren in the UFC on ESPN+ 20 headliner.

Maia (28-9 MMA, 22-9 UFC) earned the third main event victory of his octagon tenure when he scored a third-round submission win over Askren (19-2 MMA, 1-2 UFC) in the welterweight bout, which took place at Singapore Indoor Stadium in Singapore and streamed on ESPN+.

Check below for the top Twitter reactions to Maia’s victory over Askren at UFC on ESPN+ 20.

* * * *

Something told me askren and maia was gonna throw hands 😂 — Sodiq Yusuff (@Super_Sodiq) October 26, 2019

Maia with left hands to the head and body. Askren looking to get inside #UFCSingapore — Sherdog by Mandatory (@sherdogdotcom) October 26, 2019

Maia is lighting him up — caposa (@Grabaka_Hitman) October 26, 2019

I just don’t understand how someone’s striking can be this rudimentary. Like awful. But finally a TD! #UFCSingapore — Aljamain Sterling (@funkmasterMMA) October 26, 2019

Askren's longest fight in the UFC. — Jed I. Goodman (@jedigoodman) October 26, 2019

Have you ever seen such an accomplished wrestler not look that good in wrestling as much as askren — Brian Kelleher (@brianboom135) October 26, 2019

Very close first round Have it 10-9 Askren — Aaron Bronsteter (@aaronbronsteter) October 26, 2019

This is what you swapped Demetrious Johnson for. — Seán Sheehan (@SeanSheehanBA) October 26, 2019

Demian Maia landed (unofficially) more significant strikes in the first round than he has in the duration of 18 of his previous 30 fights. — Aaron Bronsteter (@aaronbronsteter) October 26, 2019

Maia from full mount to back … Askren escapes … what a scramble … #UFCSingapore — Brian Martin (@TheBMartin) October 26, 2019

Demian Maia goes from omaplata sweep to leg weave pass to mount and more before Askren scrambles out. Hold me, Jesus. — Luke Thomas (@lthomasnews) October 26, 2019

Maia is slowing down, Ben can scramble all day. This will be like qucksand if he keeps getting taken down. — Gerald Harris (@GHurricane) October 26, 2019

Fighters should know the scores during the fight. — Chas Skelly (@ChasSkelly) October 26, 2019

Nice takedown from Askren to open round three, but he can't keep Maia on the mat. #UFCSingapore — Rob Tatum (@RobTatum303) October 26, 2019

WOW! Maia chokes Askren out! Incredible third round and excellent fight! — Kevin Iole (@KevinI) October 26, 2019

👀 👀 👀 — Anthony Rocco Martin (@TonyRoccoMartin) October 26, 2019

Damn. Styles make freaking fights! #UFCSingapore — Aljamain Sterling (@funkmasterMMA) October 26, 2019

Demain Maia submits Ben Askren with a rear naked choke in the third round. Appeared to be one-armed or maybe half gripped. Need to see a replay. Suffice to say a great win for Maia and consequential loss for Askren. — Luke Thomas (@lthomasnews) October 26, 2019

& Maia just Maia’d him — Gerald Harris (@GHurricane) October 26, 2019

Parabens @demianmaia mostrando a superioridade do Jiu-jitsu sempre!! — Rafael dos Anjos (@RdosAnjosMMA) October 26, 2019

Damnnn!! Maia with the 1 handed RNC🤯 Surprised Askren wanted to go for the takedown when he was actually winning the striking exchanges and considering how dangerous Maia is. This fight was definitely more intriguing than I thought. #UFCSingapore — Megan Anderson (@MeganA_mma) October 26, 2019

I never say stuff like this but @Benaskren needs to retire. — Sean McCorkle (@BigSexyMcCorkle) October 26, 2019

Incredible fight fellas! Maia is filthy with it! https://t.co/bvG5LrihJr — Frankie Edgar (@FrankieEdgar) October 26, 2019

Daaaammmmnnn shouldn’t have pigged out at the arab spot so hard #Malkiskitchen #msg #bmf — Jorge Masvidal UFC (@GamebredFighter) October 26, 2019

i am the best grappler in mma — Dillon Danis (@dillondanis) October 26, 2019

Made a bad decision and I failed. Sorry to everyone who I let down. — Ben Askren (@Benaskren) October 26, 2019

MOST WINS – UFC History

23 – Donald Cerrone

22 – Demian Maia

20 – Georges St-Pierre

20 – Michael Bisping

20 – Jim Miller#UFCSingapore — Michael Carroll (@MJCflipdascript) October 26, 2019
description: See the top Twitter reactions to Demian Maia's submission win over Ben Askren in the UFC on ESPN+ 20 main event.
